body:
**Actionable comments posted: 4**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.claude/hooks/src/__tests__/session-id-persistence.test.ts: - Around line 76-97: The test duplicates the implementation of getSessionId, so updates to the real implementation in file-claims.ts won't be covered; remove the local getSessionId function from session-id-persistence.test.ts and import the real getSessionId from file-claims.ts, then adjust the tests to call the imported getSessionId and mock/stub fs.existsSync, fs.readFileSync and environment/braintrustSpanId inputs as needed to preserve the same scenarios. - Around line 30-57: The test currently defines a local getSessionIdFile function that duplicates logic from session-register.ts; export the real getSessionIdFile implementation from session-register.ts (or the module that owns it) and update this test to import and call that exported getSessionIdFile instead of the local copy, removing the duplicated function; alternatively, if you intend this to be a behavioural/spec test, rename the file (e.g., session-id-persistence.spec.ts) and assert it documents expected behavior‚Äîbut the preferred fix is to export getSessionIdFile from session-register.ts and replace the local implementation with an import in the test so changes to the source implementation are correctly tested. In @.claude/hooks/src/file-claims.ts: - Around line 17-20: The duplicate getSessionIdFile implementation in file-claims.ts should be removed and the module should reuse the canonical path logic from session-register (e.g., import or call the shared getSessionIdFile from the session-register module or a single shared util) so both callers compute the same path; additionally, in the code path that falls back to generating a new session ID when the file is missing or unreadable, add a debug log (using the existing logger) that records that the file was absent/unreadable and that a new ID was generated so the fallback is visible during debugging. In @.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts: - Around line 17-24: Extract the duplicated getSessionIdFile logic into a shared function (e.g., getSessionIdFile(options: { ensureDir?: boolean })) in a new shared module and replace the local implementations in both session-register.ts and file-claims.ts; implement the option so session-register calls getSessionIdFile({ ensureDir: true }) to create the .claude directory while file-claims calls getSessionIdFile() (defaulting to not creating the dir), ensuring both use the same path construction and avoiding duplication. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: ASSERTIVE **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between c52cdcc6689e6d77606c5eb94af4358d4a9cdf09 and c077c2cf7a418a0365b51a6120a17064a4109298.
‚õî Files ignored due to path filters (2) * `.claude/hooks/dist/file-claims.mjs` is excluded by `!**/dist/**` * `.claude/hooks/dist/session-register.mjs` is excluded by `!**/dist/**`
üìí Files selected for processing (3) * `.claude/hooks/src/__tests__/session-id-persistence.test.ts` * `.claude/hooks/src/file-claims.ts` * `.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts`
üß∞ Additional context used
üß¨ Code graph analysis (2)
.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts (1)
.claude/hooks/dist/session-register.mjs (1) * `claudeDir` (193-193)
.claude/hooks/src/file-claims.ts (2)
.claude/hooks/src/shared/resource-reader.ts (1) * `getSessionId` (70-72)
.claude/hooks/dist/file-claims.mjs (1) * `sessionFile` (172-172)
üîá Additional comments (9)
.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts (3)
`12-13`: **LGTM on imports.** Appropriate additions for filesystem operations required by the new persistence mechanism. --- `26-36`: **LGTM on `getSessionId()` implementation.** The Braintrust span ID fallback with truncation and timestamp-based ID generation provides reasonable defaults. --- `59-63`: **LGTM on session ID persistence.** Writing to both environment variable (for in-process access) and file (for cross-process access) correctly addresses the root cause of session ID mismatch. The silent error handling is appropriate since the environment variable fallback remains available.
.claude/hooks/src/file-claims.ts (3)
`12-13`: **LGTM on imports.** Adding `existsSync` and `join` appropriately supports the new file-based session ID retrieval. --- `48-97`: **LGTM on `main()` function.** The hook correctly integrates the new session ID retrieval, maintains existing claim/check logic, and provides appropriate conflict warnings. --- `22-41`: **LGTM on the updated `getSessionId()` logic.** The priority chain (environment ‚Üí file ‚Üí Braintrust ‚Üí generate) correctly handles cross-process persistence with appropriate fallbacks. The `.trim()` on line 33 is good defensive coding. The separate `getSessionId()` in `shared/resource-reader.ts` that uses `CLAUDE_SESSION_ID` and `process.ppid` is intentionally different‚Äîfile-claims.ts manages session-based file coordination (Phase 1), while resource-reader.ts tracks Claude-specific resource state (Phase 4). The distinction in environment variables and logic is appropriate for their separate concerns.
.claude/hooks/src/__tests__/session-id-persistence.test.ts (3)
`21-28`: **Good test hygiene with temp directory setup and cleanup.** Using `mkdtempSync` and cleaning up in `afterEach` with `rmSync` is the correct pattern for filesystem-based tests. --- `99-142`: **Good edge case coverage.** The tests cover important scenarios: - Environment variable precedence (line 99-105) - File-based retrieval (line 107-113) - Whitespace trimming (line 115-121) - Missing file fallback (line 123-127) - Complete fallback chain (line 129-133) - Empty file handling (line 135-141) These are valuable behavioral specifications even if they're testing duplicated logic. --- `144-168`: **Cross-process consistency tests validate the core fix.** These tests directly verify the PR's objective: ensuring session IDs persist across hook invocations. The simulation of write-then-read accurately reflects the real-world flow.

**Actionable comments posted: 4**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.claude/hooks/src/file-claims.ts: - Around line 23-25: Duplicate helper functions getSessionIdFile and getProject exist in file-claims.ts and session-register.ts; extract them into a single shared utility module (e.g., shared/session-utils.ts) and import from there in both files. Create the module exporting getSessionIdFile and getProject (use join from 'path' and the same HOME/CLAUDE_PROJECT_DIR fallbacks), remove the duplicate implementations from file-claims.ts and session-register.ts, and update their imports to reference the new shared/session-utils.ts to prevent drift. - Around line 41-46: The catch block that swallows read errors for sessionFile should log the error at debug level instead of being empty; inside the catch after readFileSync(...) in .claude/hooks/src/file-claims.ts, call the project's debug logger (e.g., logger.debug or console.debug) with a message that includes sessionFile and the caught error (keep behavior of returning undefined on error). Reference the existing symbols sessionFile and readFileSync and ensure the log is only debug-level so production behavior is unchanged. In @.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts: - Around line 23-29: getSessionIdFile() performs directory creation as a side effect which contradicts its "get" name; change it so directory creation is explicit either by renaming the function to ensureSessionIdFileDir() (and keep current behavior) or by splitting into a new ensureClaudeDir()/ensureSessionIdDir() function that calls mkdirSync and leaving getSessionIdFile() as a pure getter; then call the new ensure function from main() (or the write path) before any writes and update all callers to use the new names so behavior is explicit and consistent with file-claims.ts. - Line 24: The session ID file and its directory are created with default, world-readable permissions; update the directory creation in .claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts to call mkdirSync(claudeDir, { recursive: true, mode: 0o700 }) and ensure the session file write uses writeFileSync(sessionPath, sessionId, { mode: 0o600 }) (replace the existing mkdirSync and writeFileSync calls referenced in this module); make the same changes in file-claims.ts where the claudeDir/coordination session file path is constructed and where the file is written so the directory is created with mode 0o700 and the session file written with mode 0o600. ```

.claude/hooks/dist/file-claims.mjs (1) * `sessionFile` (172-172)

üîá Additional comments (4)
.claude/hooks/src/file-claims.ts (2)
`33-51`: **LGTM ‚Äî session ID resolution with proper fallback chain.** The priority order (env var ‚Üí file ‚Üí BRAINTRUST_SPAN_ID ‚Üí generated) correctly implements cross-process persistence. The file-based lookup allows `file-claims.ts` to read the ID written by `session-register.ts` even when running in a separate process. --- `66-118`: **LGTM ‚Äî main() implementation is correct.** The hook correctly: 1. Handles stdin parsing failures gracefully 2. Filters for Edit tool only 3. Checks file claims before editing 4. Warns on conflicts but allows the edit to continue 5. Claims unclaimed files for the current session
.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts (2)
`74-78`: **LGTM ‚Äî session ID persistence logic is correct.** The dual-write strategy (environment variable + file) correctly handles both in-process and cross-process scenarios: - `process.env.COORDINATION_SESSION_ID` enables fast lookup within the same process - File write enables other Node.js processes (e.g., `file-claims.ts`) to retrieve the same ID Wrapping the file write in try-catch prevents hook failure if the write fails. --- `37-43`: **Intentional asymmetry with file-claims.ts noted.** This `getSessionId()` always generates a new ID (from BRAINTRUST_SPAN_ID or timestamp), while `file-claims.ts` reads from env/file first. This is correct for the writer/reader pattern but worth documenting in a comment or shared module to prevent future confusion.

**Actionable comments posted: 4**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.claude/hooks/src/__tests__/session-id-persistence.test.ts: - Around line 214-217: The afterEach block restores HOME only if originalHome is truthy, which leaves process.env.HOME mutated when originalHome was undefined; update the afterEach in session-id-persistence.test.ts (the afterEach callback that references originalHome, process.env.HOME, fs.rmSync, and tempDir) to restore HOME deterministically by setting process.env.HOME = originalHome when originalHome is defined and deleting process.env.HOME (or setting it to undefined) when it is not, then proceed to remove tempDir via fs.rmSync. - Around line 130-143: The afterEach cleanup for HOME is inconsistent: it only reassigns process.env.HOME when originalHome is truthy, leaving the temp value if originalHome was undefined; update the afterEach block so it mirrors the COORDINATION_SESSION_ID and BRAINTRUST_SPAN_ID handling by checking originalHome !== undefined and setting process.env.HOME = originalHome when defined, otherwise deleting process.env.HOME; reference the existing afterEach, originalHome, process.env.HOME and tempDir to locate and modify the logic. In @.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts: - Around line 37-39: The code stores COORDINATION_SESSION_ID in env and calls writeSessionId(sessionId) but ignores failures; update the block around process.env.COORDINATION_SESSION_ID and writeSessionId(sessionId) to capture writeSessionId‚Äôs result or error and log a debug/error message if it fails (use the existing logger if available, otherwise console.debug/console.error), e.g., check a falsy/failed return or catch an exception from writeSessionId and log "Failed to persist session ID" along with the sessionId and error details so downstream hooks won‚Äôt silently regenerate IDs. In @.claude/hooks/src/shared/session-id.ts: - Around line 59-67: The writeSessionId function writes the session file with default permissions; update the writeFileSync call in writeSessionId to explicitly set restrictive permissions (mode: 0o600) by passing an options object (e.g., writeFileSync(filePath, sessionId, { encoding: 'utf-8', mode: 0o600 })); keep the existing try/catch behavior and retain getSessionIdFile and writeSessionId symbols. ```

üîá Additional comments (16)
.claude/hooks/src/shared/session-id.ts (6)
`1-15`: **Well-structured shared module for cross-process coordination.** The design correctly addresses the root cause of session ID mismatch by persisting to a file. The documentation clearly explains the purpose and usage. --- `26-36`: **LGTM - directory creation logic is correct.** The `recursive: true` option ensures parent directories are created, and silencing mkdir errors is acceptable since write operations will surface any real issues. --- `44-50`: **LGTM - session ID generation is reasonable.** The timestamp-based fallback using base36 provides sufficient uniqueness for coordination purposes. The 8-character truncation of BRAINTRUST_SPAN_ID maintains traceability while keeping IDs readable. --- `74-86`: **LGTM - read logic handles edge cases correctly.** The `existsSync` check is an optimization, and the try/catch correctly handles the TOCTOU race condition if the file is deleted between the check and read. --- `95-114`: **LGTM - priority resolution is correct.** The cascade (env ‚Üí file ‚Üí generate) properly handles cross-process coordination. The debug option helps troubleshoot when sessions unexpectedly generate new IDs. --- `121-123`: **LGTM!** Simple and correct project directory resolution.
.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts (2)
`14-14`: **LGTM - correct import from shared module.** Using the shared session-id utilities centralizes the session ID logic correctly. --- `21-83`: **LGTM - main function correctly integrates shared utilities.** The hook properly generates, persists, and registers the session ID. The awareness message construction and output format are correct.
.claude/hooks/src/file-claims.ts (2)
`14-14`: **LGTM - correct import from shared module.** Using `getSessionId` from the shared module ensures the file-claims hook reads the same session ID that session-register wrote. --- `21-70`: **LGTM - main function correctly uses shared session ID utilities.** The hook properly reads the session ID via `getSessionId()`, which will retrieve it from the file written by session-register, ensuring cross-process consistency. The file conflict checking logic is unchanged and correct.
.claude/hooks/src/__tests__/session-id-persistence.test.ts (6)
`1-26`: **Well-documented test file with good imports.** The header clearly explains the test purpose and the flow being validated. Importing actual implementations (rather than mocking) ensures the tests validate real behavior. --- `27-39`: **LGTM - basic path verification tests.** These tests verify the essential contract of `getSessionIdFile`. The non-throwing test for `createDir` is appropriate since actual directory creation depends on the environment. --- `41-71`: **LGTM - generateSessionId tests cover both paths.** Good use of try/finally to ensure environment variable cleanup, and both code paths (with and without BRAINTRUST_SPAN_ID) are tested. --- `73-112`: **LGTM - comprehensive read/write tests with proper isolation.** The tests correctly use a temporary HOME directory for isolation and clean up properly. The three test cases cover the essential scenarios: create, missing file, and overwrite. --- `173-201`: **LGTM - getProject tests cover both scenarios.** The tests correctly verify the environment variable precedence and cwd fallback. --- `203-241`: **Excellent cross-process consistency tests.** These tests directly validate the PR's core objective: ensuring session-register and file-claims use the same session ID via file persistence. The simulation accurately reflects the actual cross-process flow.

**Actionable comments posted: 3** > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (1)
> >
> .claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts (1)
> > `43-48`: **Consider handling `registerSession` and `getActiveSessions` failures.** > > The results from `registerSession` and `getActiveSessions` are not checked for errors. If the PostgreSQL connection fails, `sessionsResult.sessions` may be undefined, causing a runtime error on line 48. > > > >
> Proposed defensive fix > > ```diff > // Register session in PostgreSQL > const registerResult = registerSession(sessionId, project, ''); > > // Get other active sessions > const sessionsResult = getActiveSessions(project); > - const otherSessions = sessionsResult.sessions.filter(s => s.id !== sessionId); > + const otherSessions = (sessionsResult.sessions || []).filter(s => s.id !== sessionId); > ``` >
> >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.claude/hooks/src/__tests__/session-id-persistence.test.ts: - Around line 209-227: Save the original COORDINATION_SESSION_ID at the top of the test scope (e.g. let originalCoordinationSessionId: string | undefined), set originalCoordinationSessionId = process.env.COORDINATION_SESSION_ID in beforeEach before deleting it, and then in afterEach restore it (if defined, set process.env.COORDINATION_SESSION_ID = originalCoordinationSessionId; else delete process.env.COORDINATION_SESSION_ID). Update the existing beforeEach/afterEach that use tempDir and originalHome to also manage originalCoordinationSessionId so tests do not leak COORDINATION_SESSION_ID between runs. In @.claude/hooks/src/shared/session-id.ts: - Around line 74-86: The existsSync check in readSessionId creates a TOCTOU race and is redundant because readFileSync is already wrapped in try/catch; simplify readSessionId by calling readFileSync(getSessionIdFile(), 'utf-8') inside the existing try block, trim the result and return id || null, and remove the preliminary existsSync branch (and any now-unused existsSync import) so errors like missing file are handled by the catch path. - Line 27: Replace the hardcoded `/tmp` fallback for HOME with the project's consistent pattern; update the claudeDir definition so it uses process.env.HOME || process.env.USERPROFILE || '' (i.e., const claudeDir = join(process.env.HOME || process.env.USERPROFILE || '', '.claude');) to match other files like session-end-cleanup.ts and ensure Windows USERPROFILE is considered. ```

üîá Additional comments (9)
.claude/hooks/src/session-register.ts (2)
`37-41`: **Session ID persistence with graceful degradation looks good.** The implementation correctly: 1. Stores in environment for same-process access 2. Persists to file for cross-process sharing 3. Logs a warning but continues on write failure (non-blocking) This approach ensures the hook completes even if file persistence fails. --- `21-31`: **Good defensive input handling.** The try/catch around stdin reading with a graceful fallback to `{ result: 'continue' }` ensures the hook doesn't crash on malformed or missing input.
.claude/hooks/src/__tests__/session-id-persistence.test.ts (3)
`41-71`: **Test coverage for `generateSessionId` is thorough.** Good coverage of both code paths: - Timestamp-based ID when `BRAINTRUST_SPAN_ID` is not set - First 8 characters of span ID when available The `finally` blocks ensure proper environment restoration. --- `92-100`: **Good test for the write-then-read cycle.** This test validates the core persistence mechanism that fixes the original cross-process session ID mismatch issue. --- `229-238`: **Excellent integration-style test for cross-process consistency.** This test accurately simulates the flow described in the PR: 1. `session-register` writes the generated ID 2. `file-claims` (different process, no env var) reads via `getSessionId()` This directly validates the fix for the orphaned file claims bug.
.claude/hooks/src/shared/session-id.ts (4)
`26-36`: **Security-conscious directory and file permissions.** Good use of restrictive permissions: - Directory: `0o700` (owner-only access) - File: `0o600` (owner read/write only) This mitigates session ID leakage on multi-tenant systems as noted in the commit message. --- `44-50`: **Session ID generation is deterministic and compact.** The implementation correctly: - Prefers `BRAINTRUST_SPAN_ID` (first 8 chars) for traceability - Falls back to `s-` prefixed base36 timestamp for uniqueness The `s-` prefix helps distinguish self-generated IDs from span-derived ones. --- `95-114`: **Well-structured priority chain for session ID resolution.** The priority order (env ‚Üí file ‚Üí generate) correctly addresses the cross-process coordination issue: 1. Same-process hooks use env var (fastest) 2. Cross-process hooks read from file (the fix) 3. Fallback generation as last resort The optional debug logging helps diagnose coordination failures without cluttering normal output. --- `59-67`: **Write operation is simple and effective.** The implementation: - Creates the directory if needed - Writes with restrictive permissions (0o600) - Returns boolean for caller-side error handling For a small session ID value, the non-atomic write is acceptable.
